Participants.evidence: Patients with lung nodules received OTL38 (0.025mg/kg) preoperatively.

Intervention.evidence: Patients with lung nodules received OTL38 (0.025mg/kg) preoperatively.

Objective.evidence: The primary goal was to determine if OTL38 improved surgeons’ ability to identify hard-to-find nodules, occult cancers, and positive margins.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Efficacy was evaluated by occurrence of clinically significant events (CSE), occurrences that caused the surgeon to modify the operation or up-stage the patient’s cancer.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 110 patients recruited; 92 were eligible for analysis.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 110 patients recruited; 92 were eligible for analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: IMI found 24 additional nodules, 9 (10%) of which were cancers that had not been known preoperatively.

Harms.evidence: There were no serious adverse events.
